title: Bold face with really small serifs
content:
Please, help me identify the LANGE typeface. I'm pretty sure I've seen this font before but I can't figure it out by myself...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415033639im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_4620.png)

Any help appreciated.
author: hbeier

comments.content:
The contrast is most like [Serpentine](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415033639/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/serpentine/), but the G is quite different and the serifs on your sample are smaller. The only other approximately similar style was [URW Agenda](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415033639/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/agenda/), but the contrast is less and the serifs are still too big. Almost anything else I saw that may have had similar serifs was much more monotone in stroke weight (like [URW Bluejack](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415033639/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/bluejack/)).

If I were trying to reproduce this, I think I would try to customize the heavy weight of Agenda by playing with outlines to change the contrast.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks Mike!  
I think the typeface I've seen before was most likely Serpentine, but it's very different indeed.
